When asked about a lost camel, he became angry and his face reddened, saying: 'What is that to you? It has its hooves and water container; it goes to the water and grazes the trees.' When asked about a lost item, he said: 'Make it known for a year. If its owner comes, return it to him; otherwise, note its bag and wrapping, then combine it with your wealth. If the owner comes, give it to him.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ began his final illness in the house of Maymunah. He came to my house leaning on two men, his feet dragging on the ground. When he entered, I said: 'O my head aches!' He said: 'I wish it had been so, that I might witness upon you and pray over you.' I said: 'I think if that had happened, you would not have spent the evening of your day until you consummated your marriage with one of your wives.' Then he said: 'O my head aches' twice. Then he said: 'Call Abu Bakr and his son so I may make my testament to him so that no one aspires to leadership.' But Allah refused, and the believers rejected it. Ubaidullah [ibn Abdullah] said: I went out and sat with Ibn Abbas and said: 'If only you could have seen your mother Aisha saying such things.' Ibn Abbas replied: 'Who were the two men?' I said: 'As for one of them, it was al-Abbas, and as for the other, I did not name him.' Ibn Abbas said: 'The other was Ali ibn Abi Talib, but do not spread this report.'

hadiths.english_translation: This hadith contains multiple chains with different narrations. Chain 1: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf: 'I went out with Umar ibn al-Khattab one night to guard Medina. When we reached the prayer ground, a lamp appeared. Umar asked: Do you know where this lamp is? It is in the house of Rabiah ibn Umayyah ibn Khalaf, and they are drinking now. We went to his house, and when we heard noise and voices, Umar said: I do not think we have come upon something impermissible. So we turned back.' Chain 2: Narrated by Said ibn Abi Waqqas regarding bathing the Prophet ﷺ in rain water. Chain 3: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: 'Abraham, the Friend of Allah, used to visit his son Ishmael on the Buraq, which is Gabriel's beast. It steps wherever its sight reaches. This is the beast which the Messenger of Allah rode on the night of Isra.'
